modules.description: Converts hexadecimal values between string representations and an internal type, with support for S-expression serialization and comparison. Operates on the `t` type, which encapsulates hexadecimal data. Used to parse hex strings into structured values, serialize them for storage or transmission, and generate human-readable formatted outputs.

Provides operations to convert binary data to S-expressions, compare values locally or globally, and generate hash values. Works with the opaque type `t` representing binary data. Used to serialize binary structures for debugging, enforce consistent ordering in sorted collections, and generate unique identifiers for binary payloads.

Converts 32-bit integers to formatted ordinal strings with customizable digit grouping and extracts ordinal suffixes. Handles numeric values by applying specific formatting rules for readability and linguistic correctness. Used in generating human-readable numerical outputs for reports, UI displays, and localized text generation.

Converts 63-bit integers to formatted ordinal strings with custom suffixes and optional digit delimiters. Handles numeric values by appending appropriate English ordinal endings and can insert separators between groups of three digits. Useful for generating human-readable ordinal numbers in financial or statistical reports.

Converts 64-bit integers to formatted ordinal strings with customizable digit grouping and extracts ordinal suffixes. Handles large numeric values and applies linguistic rules for suffix selection. Used for generating human-readable numerical labels in financial reports and data visualization outputs.

Converts native integers to formatted ordinal strings with customizable digit grouping and extracts ordinal suffixes. Operates on nativeint values, generating human-readable representations with suffixes like "st", "nd", "rd", or "th". Useful for displaying large numbers in a readable format, such as in financial reports or user interfaces.

Provides integer division and remainder operations with distinct behaviors for negative inputs, including /% and % for consistent positive remainders, and / and rem for signed results. Includes a rounding function that adjusts integers to specified multiples, with directional control and performance-optimized variants. Supports hexadecimal and binary data manipulation, offering parsing, serialization, comparison, and hashing capabilities through opaque types. Enables precise arithmetic control, data transformation, and structured representation for both numeric and binary values.

Converts integers to their ordinal suffixes (e.g., "st", "nd", "rd", "th") using direct computation. Operates on 32-bit integers and returns strings based on numerical value. Useful for formatting numbered lists or dates in user-facing output.

Produces ordinal abbreviation strings with and without digit delimiters, and extracts ordinal suffixes. Operates on integer values to generate formatted output suitable for display in user interfaces or reports. Generates localized-style numbering such as "1st", "2nd", "3rd", "4th", and "100_002nd".
